**DISCLAIMER: This is an example of what the results will look like.**

You can find here the results from Experiment 1 carried on by Renaud Foucart and Elias Bouacida. 

The DC-2 lottery draw of XX were 5, 1, so the participant number selected is 51.

```{r settings}
source(file.path("..", 'Payments.R'))
name <- c('Arbitrary', 'Bargaining')
column_names <- c("Code", "Type", "Points", "USD", "Vote for Procedure", "Compensation Asked", "Group", "Blue Compensation", "Procedure", "Collective", "About Procedures", "Lottery")
above_header <- c("About You" = 2, " " = 1, "About the Mechanisms" = 5,  "Predictions" = 3)
```



```{r}
library(scales)
library(dplyr)
library(stringr)
library(kableExtra)
data3 <- read.csv(file = file.path(file.path('..', 'Data', 'Experiment2023ResultsExperiment1.csv')))

data3 <- data3 %>% 
  mutate(payment = scales::dollar_format()(payment)) %>% 
  rename_with( ~ str_to_title(gsub("_", " ", .x, fixed = TRUE))) %>% 
  rename_with( ~ gsub("Rps", "RPS", .x, fixed = TRUE))



kable(data3,
      # col.names = gsub("[_]", " ", names(data3)),
      align= 'c') %>% 
  add_header_above(above_header)
```
